lessons.lesson: Always get written authorization before conducting any penetration test
Never use real credentials or production data in security tests
Document all findings immediately to avoid forgetting critical vulnerabilities
Start with passive reconnaissance before active scanning
Always verify findings manually - automated tools can have false positives
Rate limit your scans to avoid triggering DOS protection or crashing services
Check for OWASP Top 10 vulnerabilities systematically

strategies.strategy: Identify vulnerability → Verify manually → Test exploit → Document → Suggest remediation
Passive recon → Active scanning → Manual testing → Exploit development → Privilege escalation
Review source → Test authentication → Check authorization → Test input validation → Check for sensitive data exposure

experiences.task: Conduct security assessment of web application
experiences.outcome: Identified 3 high-severity and 7 medium-severity vulnerabilities. All findings verified and documented.

experiences.task: Test for SQL injection vulnerabilities in login form
experiences.outcome: Confirmed SQL injection in username field. Successfully extracted database schema. Recommended parameterized queries.

experiences.task: Assess API security and test for broken authentication
experiences.outcome: Found weak JWT implementation allowing token manipulation. No rate limiting on login endpoint. Provided detailed remediation steps.
